aquarium

Class Aquarium

  • java.lang.Object
    • aquarium.Aquarium

  • public class Aquarium
extends java.lang.Object
    The Aquarium holds the animation logic for creatures which may be added using fillWithCreatures. It is normally created and started from AquariumMain.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEIGHT
      The height of the Aquarium's water area in pixels.
      static int SKY_HEIGHT
      The height of the Aquarium's sky area in pixels.
      static int WIDTH
      The width of the Aquarium in pixels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Aquarium()
      Creates an empty Aquarium.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void empty()
      Empties the Aquarium by removing all creatures.
      void fillWithCreatures()
      Fills the Aquarium by creating and adding Creatures.
      java.util.ArrayList<Creature> getCreatures()
      Gets the creatures in the Aquarium.
      void setFrame(AquariumFrame frame)
      Sets the parent AquariumFrame for this Aquarium.
      void start()
      Starts the Aquarium animation.
      void stop()
      Stops the Aquarium animation.
      void updateCreatureLocations()
      Calls the Creature.updateLocation() method for each Creature in the Aquarium, and then calls: Creature.hitLeftWall() if the left edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the left wall; Creature.hitRightWall() if the right edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the right wall; Creature.hitFloor() if the bottom edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the Aquarium floor; Creature.hitSurface() if the Creature is touching the surface of the water; Creature.hitClouds() if the Creature has touched or gone past the top of the sky.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aquarium

        public Aquarium()

    • Method Detail

      • getCreatures

        public java.util.ArrayList<Creature> getCreatures()
        Gets the creatures in the Aquarium.
        Returns:
        The list of Creature objects inhabiting the Aquarium.

      • fillWithCreatures

        public void fillWithCreatures()
        Fills the Aquarium by creating and adding Creatures.

      • empty

        public void empty()
        Empties the Aquarium by removing all creatures.

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(AquariumFrame frame)
        Sets the parent AquariumFrame for this Aquarium.
        Parameters:
        frame - The AquariumFrame for this Aquarium.

      • updateCreatureLocations

        public void updateCreatureLocations()
        Calls the Creature.updateLocation() method for each Creature in the Aquarium, and then calls:
        • Creature.hitLeftWall() if the left edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the left wall;
        • Creature.hitRightWall() if the right edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the right wall;
        • Creature.hitFloor() if the bottom edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the Aquarium floor;
        • Creature.hitSurface() if the Creature is touching the surface of the water;
        • Creature.hitClouds() if the Creature has touched or gone past the top of the sky.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Aquarium animation.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the Aquarium animation.
